SEARCH
Package com.mimecast.robin.http

Class HttpRequest

java.lang.Object
com.mimecast.robin.http.HttpRequest
public class HttpRequest extends Object
HTTP/S request container used across the project.

This class is a lightweight mutable container that represents the pieces required to perform an HTTP request. It is used by the project's internal HTTP client implementations and by higher-level utilities (for example RequestBase) to build requests in a fluent, programmatic way.

Behavior summary:

  • The URL is immutable after construction.
  • The request method defaults to GET unless supplied otherwise.
  • Headers and parameters are stored as maps and can be added with the fluent addHeader and addParam helpers.
  • Files are expressed as a map of parameter name to a pair of (filePath, mimeType) used for multipart uploads.
  • Textual content is stored in content as a Pair<String, String>: value and MIME type. When present, transports typically ignore params and files.
  • Binary payloads may be stored in object as a Pair<byte[], String> (bytes and MIME type) and are treated similarly to content by transports.
  • The class is mutable and NOT thread-safe. Create a new instance per request or synchronize externally when necessary.

Note: toString() purposefully filters the Authorization header when rendering headers to avoid leaking secrets in logs.

  • Field Details

    • url

      private final String url
      Request URL (immutable after construction).

    • method

      private HttpMethod method
      Request method. Default is GET.

    • headers

      private final Map<String,String> headers
      Headers container. Mutable map of header-name -> header-value.

    • params

      private final Map<String,String> params
      Parameters container. Typically used for form parameters in POST requests.

    • files

      private final Map<String,org.apache.commons.lang3.tuple.Pair<String,String>> files
      Files container for multipart form uploads. Key: form parameter name; Value: Pair(filePath, mimeType).

    • content

      private org.apache.commons.lang3.tuple.Pair<String,String> content
      Textual content container. Pair<contentString, mimeType>. When set, transports commonly will not send params or files.

    • object

      private org.apache.commons.lang3.tuple.Pair<byte[],String> object
      Binary object container. Pair<bytes, mimeType>. Acts similarly to content but for raw binary payloads.
